result.execSummary:
The defendant William W Griggs was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Pretrial Incarceration Credit form filed.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant William W Griggs in court with attorney Michael S. Holzman.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant enters a plea of no contest to Count 4,  Court finds defendant guilty. Ct. 6 dismissed and read-in. 

Court orders the following: 
Ct. 4:
- 6 months jail straight time STAYED for 12 months Probation
- Fine totaling $515.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation 
- Restitution of $450.84 to be paid to Chase Bank; $154.00 to be paid to Mary S.; $849.97 to be paid to Assoc. Bank as a Condition of Probation - joint and severally.
- DNA Surcharge of $200.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation
- Conditions of  Probation: Follow through with any counseling recommended by Agent. Full-time employment. No contact with victims: Mary S., St. Mary's Parish or the co-defendants. 
 -  30 days jail - 4 days credit -  Condition Time (nonworking hours) STAYED to be used at the Agents discretion.  Huber or straight time to be at the Agent's discretion.
Plea/sentencing hearing on February 9, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on January 28, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
filed by Attorney Holzman.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

Defendant William W Griggs in court with attorney Michael S. Holzman.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary Hearing requested  Preliminary time limits waived.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant moves to modify bail.  State object to modification of bail.  Court denies the request to modify bail.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 19, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Hearing on November 11, 2014 at 01:15 pm.
